STI_DOC.P: CIVIL WORKS FOR MAIN TECHNOLOGICAL PLANT OF UNIT 6 THERMAL POWER PLANT ŠOŠTANJ

CONTENTS.P: This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice for this project which was published on the EBRD website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 9 November 2010.

TERMOELEKTRARNA ŠOŠTANJ d.o.o., hereinafter referred to as "the Employer", intends using part of the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of UNIT 6 ŠOŠTANJ THERMAL POWER PLANT.
The Employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan:

• Execution of Civil Works for the main technological plant (hereinafter referred to as GTO) of the new 600 MW Unit No. 6 in the Šoštanj Thermal Power Plant Complex. All works will be carried out in Šoštanj at location of new unit 6, which will be located at location of existed Power plant Šoštanj. Planned completion of the Works is October 2014.
Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

• The contract is open to civil works contractors (companies registered for execution of civil works) in the form of single tenderer, joint venture or consortium from any country which meets the qualification criteria.

• The tenderer's qualification (of main or sub-contractor(s), or partners in a joint venture or consortium) shall be proved by appropriate project references. The tenderer shall be able to prove completion of at least two comparable projects in the last five years valued at minimum EUR 25 million each i.e. the minimum total amount of EUR 50 million. Comparable projects are considered as demanding civil engineering structures with similar complexity as the project under this tender.
• The tenderer's (the lead company) annual turnover in the last three years (2007, 2008 and 2009) should not be less than EUR 60 million equivalent.
Fee for the tender documentation is:
• for Slovenian applicants EUR 1.200,00 (VAT included)
• for foreign applicants EUR 1.000,00 (VAT excluded)
and should be paid to the business account, opened at the bank NLB d.d., Ljubljana, Slovenia:
SWIFT: LJBAS12X,
Evidence of payment must be send together with the application for tender documentation.

Tender documents can be collected in person in the office at the address below, or will be promptly dispatched by courier at applicant's costs; however, no liability can be accepted for their loss or late delivery. In the event of discrepancy between electronic and hard copies of the documents, the hard copy shall prevail.

Tender offers must be delivered to the Termoelektrarna Šoštanj d.o.o. secretarial office (located on the third floor of the head office building) on or before 04.03.2011, at 11:00 hours, and they will be opened same day at 12:00 hours in the presence of those tenderers' representatives who choose to attend and against their presentation of a written power of attorney for participation in the opening procedure.
Prospective tenderers may obtain further information from, and inspect and acquire the tender documents at, the following office:
Note:

The subject tender is not a public procurement tender in the sense of the Slovenian Public Procurement Law, since under the law of the Republic of Slovenia the Employer is not a contracting entity in the sense of public procurement and is not obliged to follow the valid regulations of the Slovenian Public Procurement in the Water, Energy, Transport and Postal Services Sector Act and of the Public Procurement Procedure Review Act.
